title: Chord: Major 7th in G# (Shape: G)
content:
# Chord: Major 7th in G# (Shape: G)

## Description
The Major 7th chord in the key of G# is a rich and vibrant chord that adds a touch of sophistication to any musical piece. It is composed of the notes G#, B#, D#, and F##. The G# Major 7th chord has a bright and uplifting sound, offering a sense of resolution and completeness.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (root note)
- B# (major 3rd)
- D# (perfect 5th)
- F## (major 7th)

## Music Genre and Flavor
The G# Major 7th chord is commonly found in jazz, R&B, and soul music. It adds a jazzy and luxurious flavor to the music, creating a smooth and sophisticated vibe. This chord is often used in slower tempo songs, creating a reflective and emotional atmosphere.

## Songs
Here are three songs that prominently feature the G# Major 7th chord:
1. "Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra
2. "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder
3. "Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones
